summary: The Cleaner Air Spaces Act of 2025 directs the EPA to provide grants to air pollution control agencies to implement a program to create cleaner air spaces.  The program involves establishing clean air centers in public buildings, distributing eligible air filtration units to low-income households at risk of wildland fire smoke exposure, and conducting educational outreach. The bill outlines grant requirements, application processes, and reporting obligations. It authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2028.
